Field.Name: Index
Description: A unique number identifiying an single observation (i.e. row) in ERA.

Field.Name: Code
Description: Each paper is assigned a unique code that can be used to identify the source of the data in the database. The code consists of your initials (first and last name) and a sequential four-digit number that begins with 0000 and goes up 1 with each paper entered.

Field.Name: Author
Description: The name of the first author, last name comes first with no punctuation. Use all initials given and do not include spaces between initials.

Field.Name: Date
Description: The year of publication.

Field.Name: Journal
Description:
Abbreviation of the journal name. We use WoS abbreviations that can be found here: https://images.webofknowledge.com/images/help/WOS/A_abrvjt.html
This field will autofill using the data in the Levels tab matching to the user selected journal name.
Example:
Soil & Tillage Research = STR 
Journal of Plant Nutrition = JPN

Field.Name: DOI
Description: DOI (or url if no DOI available) of article. DOI = Digital Object Identifier.

Field.Name: Elevation
Description: The elevation in meters (m). Provide the mid-point if a range is given.

Field.Name: Country
Description: Country Name

Field.Name: ISO.3166-1.alpha-3
Description: Standardized country name using ISO.3166-1.alpha-3. This field should be auto filled using the country selected and data in the Levels Tab,

Field.Name: Site.Type
Description:
One of the following: Farm, Station, Greenhouse, Survey, or Lab. 
Farm research is conducted in a farmer’s field and can be managed by the farmer or researcher. 
Station research is conducted in a controlled setting of research station, university or school. 
Survey research is conducted via interviews that yields quantitative data based on testimonial. 
Greenhouse is conducted in a greenhouse and is only relevant for studies of greenhouse gas emissions data. 
Lab studies can include fisheries feeding trials conducted at a small scale in university research labs.

Field.Name: Site.ID
Description: Free text name to identify the site. Include institution/station name and location or village/town in county/district, but not the country.

Field.Name: MAT
Description: Reported mean annual temperature in degrees C. If a range is given, average the values and enter the average. If mean highs and lows are given, they can be averaged to estimate the mean annual temperature.

Field.Name: MAP
Description: Mean annual precipitation (mm) for the location. This should be a long-term average for more than 10 years of data.

Field.Name: TAP
Description: Total annual precipitation (mm) for the location in the year corresponding to the outcome data

Field.Name: MSP
Description: Mean seasonal precipitation (mm) for the location in the season corresponding to the outcome data. This should be a long-term average from more than 10 years of data.

Field.Name: TSP
Description: Total seasonal precipitation (mm) for the location in the season corresponding to the outcome data

Field.Name: Soil.Type
Description: List the given soil classification/name in lowercase letters. If more than one soil type is given (within the same taxonomic system) enter both separated by a period ‘.’

Field.Name: Soil.Classification
Description: List the taxonomic system used to classify the soil. Choose from {FAO, USDA, other}.

Field.Name: Soil.Texture
Description: List the soil texture provided in the text or in tables in lowercase letters. If no texture is named, but % of sand, silt and clay are given, use the soil texture triangle to estimate soil texture (https://www.nrcs.usda.gov/wps/portal/nrcs/detail/soils/survey/?cid=nrcs142p2_054167).

Field.Name: SOC
Description: Soil organic carbon. If multiple soil depths are reported, use 0-20 cm, or the closest reported value. Do NOT use soil organic matter (SOM) or total carbon (TSC) measurements here.

Field.Name: SOC.Unit
Description: Units provided for soil organic carbon. Usually either g/kg or % (also can be density kg/m3 or stocks t/ha)

Field.Name: SOC.Depth
Description: Concatenate min (top) and max (bottom) depths user entered with a "-", e.g. 0-10.

Field.Name: Soil.pH
Description: Soil pH value derived during site characterization. If multiple methods for pH are given, report the water (H2O) method.

Field.Name: Soil.pH.Method
Description: Method used to calculate soil pH.

Field.Name: Plant.Start
Description: Starting of planting period (dd.mm.yyyy)

Field.Name: Plant.End
Description: End of planting period (dd.mm.yyyy)

Field.Name: Harvest.Start
Description: Starting of harvest period (dd.mm.yyyy)

Field.Name: Harvest.End
Description: End of harvest period (dd.mm.yyyy)

Field.Name: Rep
Description: The number of replicates for the treatments. If the number varies between treatments, use the lowest number. If no number is given, leave blank.

Field.Name: Plot.Size
Description: The size of the smallest treatment plot unit in m2. If plot dimensions are given, calculate the area in m2. For example, if the size of the subplots is 6m x 4m, the Plot.Size is 24 (m2).

Field.Name: CID
Description: A unique identifier (within study) describing a set of management practices that occurred in the control which is used to identify the treatment combinations tested, to allow comparison across outcomes in a paper. A default system of T1, T2, T3, etc. can be used. CID should describe the treatment used as the control for this observation.

Field.Name: C.Descrip
Description: [Superceded by C.Descrip.Clean column] Free text description of the control treatment. Use sufficient detail to easily identify the practices.

Field.Name: C.NI
Description: Amount of inorganic (chemical) nitrogen applied to control plots in kg/ha

Field.Name: C.NO
Description: Amount of nitrogen in organic materials (manures or compost, but not residues) applied to control plots, preferably in kg/ha. If no nitrogen content is provided, please list amount of organic manure applied with a ‘t’ to symbolize tonnes.

Field.Name: TID
Description: A unique identifier (within study) describing a set of management practices that occurred in treatment which is used to identify the treatment combinations tested, to allow comparison across outcomes in a paper. A default system of T1, T2, T3, etc. can be used. TID should describe the treatment used as the control for this observation.

Field.Name: T.Descrip
Description: [Superceded by T.Descrip.Clean column] Free text description of the CSA treatment. Use sufficient detail to easily identify all the component practices.

Field.Name: T.NI
Description: Amount of inorganic (chemical) nitrogen (N) applied to CSA treatment in kg/ha

Field.Name: T.NO
Description: Amount of nitrogen (N) in organic materials (manures or compost) applied to CSA treatment, preferably in kg/ha. If no nitrogen content is provided, please list amount of organic manure applied with a ‘t’ to symbolize tonnes.

Field.Name: Diversity
Description: Name of species in intercrop or rotations including the crop, first letter of name capitilized and the rest lowercase. Use a dash (-) for intercrops and forward slash (/) for rotation. Use common names of species, unless agroforestry species, then use scientific name. This should be used for both crop and agroforestry intercroppings.

Field.Name: Variety
Description: Commercial name of the crop or animal variety. Do not include the type of crop or animal in field (e.g. Maasai Red Goats should be Maasai Red).

Field.Name: Tree
Description: Name of tree species used in agroforestry experiments, can be both as an intercrop or as an agroforestry mulch. Please use scientific name and be careful of your spelling. Use full scientific name, do not abbreviate genus (e.g., Mangifera indica should not be abbreviated to M.indica).

Field.Name: Duration
Description: Length of time the experiment has been ongoing up to the date the data are being reported for in years. In bimodal rainfall systems with multiple growing seasons, seasons are identified by fractions of the year, 0.5, etc. If outcomes are reported in a unimodal rainfall system with one growing season per year, the duration can be equivalent to one year.

Field.Name: M.Year
Description: The calendar year the measurement was taken. Seasons in multi-season systems are identified by decimals ‘.1’ or ‘.2’ for the first and second season respectively. When the measurements are average values for more than one year create a decimal for the years covered.

Field.Name: M.Year.Start
Description: First year the measurement was taken (YYYY). For yield or similar outcomes this should relate to the harvest year (rather than the planting year). Where data are aggregated across years also complete the Measurement End Year Field.

Field.Name: M.Year.End
Description: This only required for temporally aggregated observations (e.g. a result that has been averaged from crop yields reported from 2000,2001 and 2002). Here report the last year of the period over for which observations were aggregated (in the previous example this would be 2002).

Field.Name: Season.Start
Description:
This only required in areas where there are mutiple growing seasons in a year (e.g., areas with bimodal rainfall or irrigated cropping in dry seasons of a unimodal system).
Leave blank where there is only one growing season per year or no seasonal information is presented with the data.
Code the season in order 1,2,etc. Determine the season sequence by harvest year. If there are two cropping seasons, with crops harvested in Feb and Sept, Feb = season 1 and Sept = season 2.

Field.Name: Season.End
Description: This only required for temporally aggregated observations in areas with more than one growing season (e.g. a result that has been averaged from crop yields reported from 2000 season 1,2001 season 1 and 2002 season 1). Here report the last season of the period over for which observations were aggregated (in the previous example this would be 1).

Field.Name: EU
Description: The experimental unit (EU) for which experiment outcomes are reported. This usually a crop or animal product. For cookstove papers it may be a cookstove. The EU for soil outcomes should be the crop(s) grown on the soil unless no crops are grown at all. Letters in the code should be lowercase. If the outcome refers to multiple experimental units (e.g. soil outcomes during an intercropping experiment) select all experimental units separated by a period (see EU2 tab).

Field.Name: Outcode
Description: The productivity, resilience, or mitigation outcome indicator that data are being reported on (see OUTCOMES2 tab).

Field.Name: Units
Description: Free text description of the units of the data being reported without special characters or formatting.

Field.Name: MeanC
Description: The value that corresponds to the control treatment and outcome. Please standard yields to t/ha where appropropriate, keeping as many decimal places as there is data for.

Field.Name: MeanT
Description: The value that corresponds to the CSA treatment and outcome. Please standard yields to kg/ha where appropropriate, keeping as many decimal places as there is data for.

Field.Name: Upper
Description: The depth for which the MeanC and MeanT correspond for soil properties in cm (lowest depth value = upper, so if you have a depth of 0-20 cm the lowest value = 20).

Field.Name: Lower
Description: The depth for which the MeanC and MeanT correspond for soil properties in cm (highest depth value = lower, so if you have a depth of 0-20 cm the highest value = 0).

Field.Name: DataLoc
Description: The location in the paper where the data can be found. This should be three letters (fig, tab, or txt) in lowercase and a number (for figures and tables) to signify figure, table or text, respectively.

Field.Name: USD2010.C
Description: Monetary outcomes converted to International USD 2010 using World Bank CPI, PPP and exchange rates. There are no reliable data for Zimbabwe.

Field.Name: USD2010.T
Description: Monetary outcomes converted to International USD 2010 using World Bank CPI, PPP and exchange rates. There are no reliable data for Zimbabwe.

Field.Name: MeanFlip
Description: Is a negative result considered better than a positive result (i.e. MeanT/MeanC <1 = good)? This is indexed in using the Outcode field in the compednium and the "Negative Values" field in the OUTCOMES tab

Field.Name: T.Feed.Source
Description: Where were livestock diets in the treatment practice(s) sourced from?
Example:
Purchased
Produced On-farm
Purchased & Produced On-farm

Field.Name: C.Feed.Source
Description: Where were livestock diets in the control practice(s) sourced from?
Example:
Purchased
Produced On-farm
Purchased & Produced On-farm

Field.Name: Species
Description: The tree species for which the experiment outcome are reported

Field.Name: Partial.Outcome.Name
Description: Free text to describe the partial outcome

Field.Name: Analysis.Function
Description: Describes the logical process used to compare control to treatment (for developers)

Field.Name: Version
Description: Year in which the ERA data entry took place. Either 2018 or 2020

Field.Name: Irrigation.C
Description: Indicates the presence of irrigation in the control treatment

Field.Name: Irrigation.T
Description: Indicates the presence of irrigation in the experimental treatment

Field.Name: Irrig.Meth.C
Description: Method of irrigation used in the control treatment. Cell will be blank if Irrigation.C is FALSE

Field.Name: Irrig.Meth.T
Description: Method of irrigation used in the experimental treatment. Cell will be blank if Irrigation.T is FALSE

Field.Name: C1:Cn
Description: Codes corresponding to all practices used on the control treatment described in C.Descrip. Only one code is placed in each column (see subpractices column of PRACTICES2 tab).

Field.Name: T1:Tn
Description: Codes corresponding to all practices used on the CSA treatment described in T.Descrip. Only one code is placed in each column (see subpractices column of PRACTICES2 tab).

Field.Name: ID
Description: Study number

Field.Name: obs_count
Description: Number of observations

Field.Name: out_count
Description: Number of outcomes reported per study

Field.Name: Lat
Description: Latitude of study location in degrees or decimal degrees, the latter recorded to same accuracy as in publication (or estimated from googlemaps where locations were found from site names/descriptions

Field.Name: Lon
Description: Longitude of study location in degrees or decimal degrees, the latter recorded to same accuracy as in publication (or estimated from googlemaps where locations were found from site names/descriptions

Field.Name: yi
Description: the natural log of the response ratio log(MeanT/MeanC)

Field.Name: pc
Description: pc=proportional change.It is a measure of the ratio of experimental to control outcomes

Field.Name: plist
Description: experimental ERA practices that are in the experimental, but not the control treatment

Field.Name: base.list
Description: base practices that are shared between experimental and control treatments

Field.Name: EUlist
Description: the product code OutcomeCodes$Code for the observation using a - delim for multiple products

Field.Name: Out.Pillar
Description: Outcome pillar name

Field.Name: Out.SubPillar
Description: Outcome subpillar name

Field.Name: Out.Ind
Description: Outcome indicator name

Field.Name: Out.SubInd
Description: Outcome subindicator name

Field.Name: SubPrName
Description: Experimental subpractice name (note that this corresponds to the Subpractice.S field in the PracticeCodes)

Field.Name: PrName
Description: Experimental practice name

Field.Name: Theme
Description: Experimental practice theme name

Field.Name: SubPrName.Base
Description: Base practice name (note that this corresponds to the Subpractice.S field in the PracticeCodes)

Field.Name: PrName.Base
Description: Base practice name

Field.Name: Theme.Base
Description: Base practice theme name

Field.Name: Product
Description: The full name of the product, including aspect of the component such as grain, meat or milk

Field.Name: Product.Type
Description: Product type name

Field.Name: Product.Subtype
Description: Product subtype name

Field.Name: Product.Simple
Description: Simplified product name, excluding any aspects of component

Field.Name: Latitude
Description: Latitude of study location in degrees or decimal degrees

Field.Name: Longitude
Description: Longitude of study location in degrees or decimal degrees

Field.Name: Buffer
Description: Manual estimation (e.g. from measuring on google earth) in m of the spatial uncertainty for a point location. The site should within an X m radius (the buffer.manual amount) of the point location specified. Unit is meters

Field.Name: Site.Key
Description: Longitude, latitude and buffer for the site

Field.Name: AEZ16simple
Description: Simplified version of AEZ16 removing the tropic/subtropic classification

Field.Name: AEZ16
Description: AEZs for Africa South of the Sahara (SSA) based on the methodology developed by FAO and IIASA, using the scheme with 16 classes

Field.Name: AEZ5
Description: AEZs Africa South of the Sahara (SSA) based on the methodology developed by FAO and IIASA, using the scheme with 5 classes

Field.Name: Mean.Annual.Precip
Description: Mean annual precipitation (mm) derived from the CHIRPS 2.0 dataset API at 0.05&deg resolution

Field.Name: Mean.Annual.Temp
Description: Mean annual temperature (C) derived from the NASA POWER dataset API at 0.5&deg resolution

Field.Name: CLY
Description: Weight percentage of clay particles (<0.0002 mm)

Field.Name: SLT
Description: Weight percentage of silt particles (0.0002-0.05 mm)

Field.Name: SND
Description: Weight percentage of the sand particles (0.05-2 mm)
